markdownRemark.html: worked on an internal B2B platform for CCA for a 3 week contract to help wrangle the front-end code base. The main theme for the problems that would surface was that the data that was being shown was not consistent – adding an product to the cart might not update the total products number in the cart, where as it would show something like ‘4 added’ in the product card itself. I decided to add a thin backbone.js layer to handle all data, allowing views to subscribe to and publish changes to data. I chose to use backbone here as it’s very easy to spatter it’s usage in many places as needed rather than having to refactor large portions of a large existing codebase. Most of the team were offshore and did not have experience with backbone.js so I spent a good chunk of my time on this project putting together demonstrations and getting the remote team up to scratch with backbone.js.
